Package io.permazen

Class UntypedJObject

java.lang.Object
io.permazen.UntypedJObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
JObject
public abstract class UntypedJObject extends Object implements JObject
Represents a JObject for which no Java model type is defined in the instance's associated schema.

Instances of this class are used to represent objects with a type that is defined in some database schema other than the current one. This situation can occur when a new schema drops a previously defined Java model type of which objects still exist in the database. If encountered, such objects are represented by instances of this class.

These objects are still fully accessible, but they must be accessed via introspection using the JTransaction field access methods, with the upgradeVersion parameter set to false (to prevent a TypeNotInSchemaException).

For example, suppose a schema update replaces a field referencing Account with a simple String field containing the account ID. Then the corresponding schema migration might look like this: 

      @OnSchemaChange
      private void applySchemaChanges(Map<String, Object> oldValues) {
          if (oldValues.containsKey("account")) {                         // was replaced with "accountId"
              final JObject acct = (JObject)oldValues.get("account");     // acct has type UntypedJObject
              final JTransaction jtx = this.getTransaction();
              final String acctId = (String)jtx.readSimpleField(acct.getObjId(), 12345, false);
              this.setAccountId(acctId);
          }
          // ...etc
      }
